docs.text:
Information and Disclaimer About this page I used some special markdown extension which is not available on normal md document, since it is not a basic syntax I’ll include it on the bottom of the pages, some of them are made with Mkdocs like buttons which you might use so I’ll also put them as basic syntaxes in this guide List of python markdown extensions There is already a guide written here for md file Link to guide , this is the link for the simplified cheat sheet Link The goal of this guide is to make it easy to understand for everyone so I’ll refrain from adding alternate syntaxes unless it would be useful to know both of them I’ll write how the syntaxes work using this template This is written in the md file This is shown on the website Since mkdocs support HTML some HTML tag are allowed inside this md file Basic syntaxes Headings Table of contents will only show text tagged with heading, if there are two Heading 1

the Table of contents will be hidden Heading 1 # Heading 1 < h1 > Heading 1 Heading 2 ## Heading 2 < h2 > Heading 2 And so on ### And so on < h3 > And so on Note about heading Notice that every heading will use space after # Since there is only 6 heading in html, anything beyond 6 # will be generated with the text. Always put spacing between heading for compatibility e.g {Page Title} ### Heading {Content} # There is no such thing as h7 ####### There is no such thing as h7 < h6 > # There is no such thing as h7 Paragraphs To create a paragraphs just write normally without any syntax To create a paragraphs just write normally without any syntax < p > To create a paragraphs just write normally without any syntax Line Breaks You can use 2 spaces and Enter key, or put
on the end of a line. It is recommended to only use
when you need more than 1 line break Paragraph 1. Paragraph 2. Paragraph 1. Paragraph 2. Different ways to add line break The first way Paragraph 1. Paragraph 2. The alternate way Paragraph 1.
Paragraph 2. < p > Paragraph 1. < br > Paragraph 2. Line Spacing This is line break This is Spacing This is line break This is Spacing Lists Always add spacing before and after a lists, if you didn’t add a spacing the next line would be indented with the list, lists also won’t work if you didn’t add spacing before the lists * Not working Working I’m indented Not indented Long text.... * Not working * Working I'm indented Not indented Ordered Lists See Link For more information One Two Three 1. One 2. Two 3. Three Unordered Lists One Two Three * One * Two * Three To start unordered lists with number you need to specify \ One 2. Two * 1. One * 2\. Two Nested Lists Nested Unordered Lists One Two Three * One * Two * Three Nested Ordered Lists One Two One Two Three 1. One 2. Two 1. One 2. Two 3. Three Nested Both Unordered and Ordered Lists One Two One Two Three 1. One 2. Two * One * Two 3. Three Buttons There are two types of button template that are built in with mkdocs-material, button and primary button. I’m not that Important Hover Me You are basically just making a link but with a little styling it will looks like a button, meaning you could also add a title for a button [I'm not that Important](#buttons){.md-button} [Hover Me](#buttons "I'm kinda Important"){.md-button .md-button--primary} Notice {} are added after the link? Those are CSS styling that you could add to md files, this is possible by using attribute list extension < a class = "md-button" href = "#buttons" > I’m not that Important < a class = "md-button md-button--primary" href = "#buttons" title = "I'm kinda Important" > Hover Me In sort to make a button just add {.md-button} , if you wanted to make it a primary button you need to add both classes {.md-button .md-primary} Links This is a Link [This is a Link](/#) < a href = "/#" > This is a Link You could also add a title and format a link Link *[Link](/# "Did I pique your interest?")* < em >< a href = "/#" title = "Did I pique your interest?" > Link If you url contain any spaces make sure to encode it using %20 [Link](https://example.com/some site) <– Bad Example [Link](https://example.com/some%20site) <– This is the correct way Urls and Email Addresses https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka example@example.com Reference-style links If you write a guide where you might reference multiple same link more than once, the easiest way would be to use reference-style links. Formatting the reference-style link For example if you might reference the Tae Kim link more than once you can used The code used in the text are formatted like this [Tae Kim][The number of the referenced link] [Tae Kim][1] To use a reference-style link you need to store your reference link first, to do that you can use this formatting, don’t worry where to put them, they will always be hidden unless you did something wrong. I recommend storing the link on the bottom of every pages or on top of every pages since It will be easier to manage or just put it on the bottom of the text after the link is referenced, it is also possible to reference browser subdirectory if you wanted to put image instead of link. [The number of the referenced link]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" [1]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" Note that you can store more than 1 reference-style link reference-style link in Action If you are new to grammar, Tae Kim Grammar Guide is the most recommended to beginner! > If you are new to grammar, [Tae Kim Grammar Guide][1] is the most recommended to beginner! [1]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" Emphasis You should have been able to do these since discord uses this syntaxes to add emphasis to a text Bold Not Bold Bold . Not Bold **Bold**. < p > Not Bold < strong > Bold . Italic Not Italic Italic . Not Italic *Italic*. < p > Not Italic < em > Italic . Combining Bold and Italic This text is somewhat important . This text is ***somewhat important*** . < p > This text is < strong >< em > somewhat important . Blockquotes Different ways to add blockquotes Always add space after a blockquotes Basic blockquotes This is a blockquotes > This is a blockquotes < blockquote >< p > This is a blockquotes Multiple lines blockquotes This may contain a blank line end > This may contain a blank line > > end < blockquote >< p > This may contain a blank line < p > end Nested blockquotes This may contain a blank line This ending is nested > This may contain a blank line > >> This ending is nested < blockquote > < p > This may contain a blank line < blockquote >< p > This ending is nested Blockquotes with other elements You can use other element like list, link, bold, etc. Some element might not be usable though, to use list you’ll need a blank space before the new line (nested blockquote is counted as a new line). I know what I’m getting into [This is a line break]–> * This is not nested This is not nested but with new lines This is nested > I **know** [This is a line break]--> > * This is not nested > > * This is not nested but with new lines >> * This is nested < blockquote > < p > I < strong > know what I’m getting into [This is a line break]– > < br > * This is not nested < ul > < li > This is not nested but with new lines < blockquote > < ul > < li > This is nested Blockquotes without new line Remember to always add space after a blockquote, Note that the last nested line will wrap the text below the nested line not the first blockquote I know what I’m getting into I’m just following the guy above [This is a line break]–> I don’t know what I’m getting into [^ Blank line before blockquote] I’m lucky to escape this madness > I know what I'm getting into >> I'm just following the guy above [This is a line break]--> I don't know what I'm getting into [^ Blank line before blockquote] I'm lucky to escape this madness < blockquote > < p > I know what I’m getting into < blockquote > < p > I’m just following the guy above [This is a line break]– > < br > I don’t know what I’m getting into < p > [^ Blank line before blockquote] I’m lucky to escape this madness Code You can use 2 backticks ` to mark a short code, you cannot use it on a code more than one line. console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); `console.log("This code does not exceed one line");` < code > console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); Code Blocks and Fenced Code Blocks This is a code block This is also a code block Fenced code block is wrapped with ```code``` , while the default code block can be done by ony using either the Tab key or four Space key ``` This is a code block ``` This is also a code block You can also specify the language of the code on a fenced code block but you cannot specify it on the default code block print ( "Hello World" ) ```python print("Hello World") ``` This is the result with default code block python print("Hello World") python print("Hello World") Escaping Backticks For example if you wanted to use `code` in your Markdown file. You can use `` For example if you wanted to use `code` in your Markdown file `` Horizontal Rule This is a horizontal rule, always add spacing before and after a horizontal rule --- < hr > Images ![AIM Banner](https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png "AIM - Another Immersion Method") < img alt = "AIM Banner" src = "https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png" title = "AIM - Another Immersion Method" > Using reference-style links as Images Url You can also use Reference-style Link to display Images, it’s the same as the default image but you will need to replace the link inside the bracket () to the link on the reference-style link. The image title should also be specified on the reference-style link if you want it to display a title when hovered on the ![AIM Banner][5] [5]: https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png "AIM - Another Immersion Method" Result : Adding Captions to Image Since Mkdocs support HTML HTML on md files it is possible to add captions to an image by using

docs.text: There are two types of button template that are built in with mkdocs-material, button and primary button. I’m not that Important Hover Me You are basically just making a link but with a little styling it will looks like a button, meaning you could also add a title for a button [I'm not that Important](#buttons){.md-button} [Hover Me](#buttons "I'm kinda Important"){.md-button .md-button--primary} Notice {} are added after the link? Those are CSS styling that you could add to md files, this is possible by using attribute list extension < a class = "md-button" href = "#buttons" > I’m not that Important </ a > < a class = "md-button md-button--primary" href = "#buttons" title = "I'm kinda Important" > Hover Me </ a > In sort to make a button just add {.md-button} , if you wanted to make it a primary button you need to add both classes {.md-button .md-primary}

I recommend storing the link on the bottom of every pages or on top of every pages since It will be easier to manage or just put it on the bottom of the text after the link is referenced, it is also possible to reference browser subdirectory if you wanted to put image instead of link. docs.text: You can use 2 backticks ` to mark a short code, you cannot use it on a code more than one line. console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); `console.log("This code does not exceed one line");` < code > console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); </ code >
docs.title: Code

docs.text: This is a code block This is also a code block Fenced code block is wrapped with ```code``` , while the default code block can be done by ony using either the Tab key or four Space key ``` This is a code block ``` This is also a code block You can also specify the language of the code on a fenced code block but you cannot specify it on the default code block print ( "Hello World" ) ```python print("Hello World") ``` This is the result with default code block python print("Hello World") python print("Hello World")

docs.title: Images

docs.text: You can also use Reference-style Link to display Images, it’s the same as the default image but you will need to replace the link inside the bracket () to the link on the reference-style link. The image title should also be specified on the reference-style link if you want it to display a title when hovered on the ![AIM Banner][5] [5]: https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png "AIM - Another Immersion Method" Result :
docs.title: Using reference-style links as Images Url

docs.text: Since Mkdocs support HTML HTML on md files it is possible to add captions to an image by using <figure> and <figcaption> HTML tag The legendary Anki < figure > < img alt = "Anki Logo Icon" src = "https://animefangirl.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Anki-icon.svg_.png" title = "Anki" style = "max-height:200px;" /> < figcaption > The Legendary Anki </ figcaption > </ figure > You will need to write it like the code above (You can specify your own images) to make it works since you cant put md inside HTML.
docs.title: Adding Captions to Image

docs.text: Left Example : ![ Placeholder ]( https://dummyimage.com/600x400/eee/aaa ){ align=left } Result : Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa. When aligning image, if the text doesn’t fill the spaces left beside the images, the next line text would be move to fill the spaces, only use alignment inside tab Right Example : ![ Placeholder ]( https://dummyimage.com/600x400/eee/aaa ){ align=right } Result : Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa. When aligning image, if the text doesn’t fill the spaces left beside the images, the next line text would be move to fill the spaces, only use alignment inside tab If there’s insufficient space to render the text next to the image, the image will stretch to the full width of the viewport, e.g. on mobile viewports.
docs.title: Image alignment

docs.text: To escape specials character that might have special effects on the md files like * for example, you can use \ 自動詞 is a verb that doesn’t need an object to make a complete sentence (Intransitive verb) * 他動詞 is a verb that needs an object to make a complete sentence (transitive verb). * 自動詞 is a verb that doesn't need an object to make a complete sentence (Intransitive verb) \* 他動詞 is a verb that needs an object to make a complete sentence (Transitive verb). List of escapable characters using backslash \
docs.title: Escaping Characters

docs.text: Since mkdocs support markdown extensions, I’ve added the extensions to make HTML works on md file, so almost every HTML tag should be working unless you’re trying to add the tag to works on the head part. Bold Me Bold Me < strong > Bold Me
docs.title: Using HTML on md file

docs.text: To make a table you need to use three or more hyphens --- to create the column’s header, use | to separate each column. Remember to add spacing before making a table Syntax Description Header Title Paragraph Text | Syntax | Description | | ----------- | --- | | Header | Title | | Paragraph | Text | As long as you use at least three hyphens to separate the column it will works
docs.title: Tables

docs.text: You can align text in the columns to the left, right, or center by adding a colon : to the left, right, or on both side of the hyphens within the header row Left Gang Header Middle Gang Header Right Gang Header Something Something3 Something5 Something2 Something4 Something6
docs.title: Alignment

docs.text: AIM - Another Immersion Method Introduction This guide is written by Perditio’s Community to help you achieve your goal in learning japanese Useful Tips You can use theㅤ S ㅤkey on your keyboard to use the search bar quicker! Do you see the button on left side of the search bar? You can use it to change the theme to dark mode/ light mode Pro-tip Immerse More. Site Progress If you are willing to contribute to this project, please head to our discord server! Project is going at a fast pace thanks to all contributor
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Resources Guide/Blog Check these awesomes Guide List of Guide/Blog Learn Japanese The Moe Way Awesome Japanese Guide, Guide for Visual Novels first timers and how to properly set Yomichan + Resources. Animecards Site Learn how to create and start mining Japanese sentences card. Blog and Resources by Eminent Post and resources made by Eminent Refold Roadmap Anime Recommendation Anime sorted by Difficulty Information Author: TyoCre E: For utter beginners [0-100 episodes] M: If you’ve watched more than 100 episodes of anime Keep in mind that these are all pretty easy so you can just dive into M P.S: With all these being said, the best stuff to watch especially when you’re still an utter beginner, would be something you’ve already watched. You already know what’s going on, which makes it way more enjoyable, even if it means you already know all the twists. Rating Anime Name Genre Episodes MAL/Anilist Link Note E Love Live Music, SoL 26, 2 Seasons MAL / Anilist Most recommended as first watch E The Idolm@ster Music, SoL 25 MAL / Anilist It gets way better after Episode 2 E Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai Comedy, SoL 25, 2 Seasons MAL / Anilist - E Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai Harem, Comedy, SoL 26, 2 Seasons MAL / Anilist - E New Game! Comedy, SoL 24, 2 Seasons MAL / Anilist - E Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san Comedy, SoL 12 MAL / Anilist - E K-On! Music, SoL 39, 2 Seasons MAL / Anilist If you want cute girls+ music, watch Love Live or Idolm@ster over K-On!, they’re way better M Full Metal Alchemist: Brotherhood Shounen, Comedy 64 MAL / Anilist This is surprisingly easy, considering the military aspect, but as long as you have Yomichan and subs this should be relatively enjoyable and easy M One Piece Shounen, Comedy 980+ (Ongoing) MAL / Anilist - M Hunter x Hunter Shounen, Comedy 148 MAL / Anilist -

You already know what’s going on, which makes it way more enjoyable, even if it means you already know all the twists. docs.title: 承認

docs.text:
Information and Disclaimer About this page I used some special markdown extension which is not available on normal md document, since it is not a basic syntax I’ll include it on the bottom of the pages, some of them are made with Mkdocs like buttons which you might use so I’ll also put them as basic syntaxes in this guide List of python markdown extensions There is already a guide written here for md file Link to guide , this is the link for the simplified cheat sheet Link The goal of this guide is to make it easy to understand for everyone so I’ll refrain from adding alternate syntaxes unless it would be useful to know both of them I’ll write how the syntaxes work using this template This is written in the md file This is shown on the website Since mkdocs support HTML some HTML tag are allowed inside this md file Basic syntaxes Headings Table of contents will only show text tagged with heading, if there are two Heading 1

the Table of contents will be hidden Heading 1 # Heading 1 < h1 > Heading 1 Heading 2 ## Heading 2 < h2 > Heading 2 And so on ### And so on < h3 > And so on Note about heading Notice that every heading will use space after # Since there is only 6 heading in html, anything beyond 6 # will be generated with the text. Always put spacing between heading for compatibility e.g {Page Title} ### Heading {Content} # There is no such thing as h7 ####### There is no such thing as h7 < h6 > # There is no such thing as h7 Paragraphs To create a paragraphs just write normally without any syntax To create a paragraphs just write normally without any syntax < p > To create a paragraphs just write normally without any syntax Line Breaks You can use 2 spaces and Enter key, or put
on the end of a line. It is recommended to only use
when you need more than 1 line break Paragraph 1. Paragraph 2. Paragraph 1. Paragraph 2. Different ways to add line break The first way Paragraph 1. Paragraph 2. The alternate way Paragraph 1.
Paragraph 2. < p > Paragraph 1. < br > Paragraph 2. Line Spacing This is line break This is Spacing This is line break This is Spacing Lists Always add spacing before and after a lists, if you didn’t add a spacing the next line would be indented with the list, lists also won’t work if you didn’t add spacing before the lists * Not working Working I’m indented Not indented Long text.... * Not working * Working I'm indented Not indented Ordered Lists See Link For more information One Two Three 1. One 2. Two 3. Three Unordered Lists One Two Three * One * Two * Three To start unordered lists with number you need to specify \ One 2. Two * 1. One * 2\. Two Nested Lists Nested Unordered Lists One Two Three * One * Two * Three Nested Ordered Lists One Two One Two Three 1. One 2. Two 1. One 2. Two 3. Three Nested Both Unordered and Ordered Lists One Two One Two Three 1. One 2. Two * One * Two 3. Three Buttons There are two types of button template that are built in with mkdocs-material, button and primary button. I’m not that Important Hover Me You are basically just making a link but with a little styling it will looks like a button, meaning you could also add a title for a button [I'm not that Important](#buttons){.md-button} [Hover Me](#buttons "I'm kinda Important"){.md-button .md-button--primary} Notice {} are added after the link? Those are CSS styling that you could add to md files, this is possible by using attribute list extension < a class = "md-button" href = "#buttons" > I’m not that Important < a class = "md-button md-button--primary" href = "#buttons" title = "I'm kinda Important" > Hover Me In sort to make a button just add {.md-button} , if you wanted to make it a primary button you need to add both classes {.md-button .md-primary} Links This is a Link [This is a Link](/#) < a href = "/#" > This is a Link You could also add a title and format a link Link *[Link](/# "Did I pique your interest?")* < em >< a href = "/#" title = "Did I pique your interest?" > Link If you url contain any spaces make sure to encode it using %20 [Link](https://example.com/some site) <– Bad Example [Link](https://example.com/some%20site) <– This is the correct way Urls and Email Addresses https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka example@example.com Reference-style links If you write a guide where you might reference multiple same link more than once, the easiest way would be to use reference-style links. Formatting the reference-style link For example if you might reference the Tae Kim link more than once you can used The code used in the text are formatted like this [Tae Kim][The number of the referenced link] [Tae Kim][1] To use a reference-style link you need to store your reference link first, to do that you can use this formatting, don’t worry where to put them, they will always be hidden unless you did something wrong. I recommend storing the link on the bottom of every pages or on top of every pages since It will be easier to manage or just put it on the bottom of the text after the link is referenced, it is also possible to reference browser subdirectory if you wanted to put image instead of link. [The number of the referenced link]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" [1]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" Note that you can store more than 1 reference-style link reference-style link in Action If you are new to grammar, Tae Kim Grammar Guide is the most recommended to beginner! > If you are new to grammar, [Tae Kim Grammar Guide][1] is the most recommended to beginner! [1]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" Emphasis You should have been able to do these since discord uses this syntaxes to add emphasis to a text Bold Not Bold Bold . Not Bold **Bold**. < p > Not Bold < strong > Bold . Italic Not Italic Italic . Not Italic *Italic*. < p > Not Italic < em > Italic . Combining Bold and Italic This text is somewhat important . This text is ***somewhat important*** . < p > This text is < strong >< em > somewhat important . Blockquotes Different ways to add blockquotes Always add space after a blockquotes Basic blockquotes This is a blockquotes > This is a blockquotes < blockquote >< p > This is a blockquotes Multiple lines blockquotes This may contain a blank line end > This may contain a blank line > > end < blockquote >< p > This may contain a blank line < p > end Nested blockquotes This may contain a blank line This ending is nested > This may contain a blank line > >> This ending is nested < blockquote > < p > This may contain a blank line < blockquote >< p > This ending is nested Blockquotes with other elements You can use other element like list, link, bold, etc. Some element might not be usable though, to use list you’ll need a blank space before the new line (nested blockquote is counted as a new line). I know what I’m getting into [This is a line break]–> * This is not nested This is not nested but with new lines This is nested > I **know** [This is a line break]--> > * This is not nested > > * This is not nested but with new lines >> * This is nested < blockquote > < p > I < strong > know what I’m getting into [This is a line break]– > < br > * This is not nested < ul > < li > This is not nested but with new lines < blockquote > < ul > < li > This is nested Blockquotes without new line Remember to always add space after a blockquote, Note that the last nested line will wrap the text below the nested line not the first blockquote I know what I’m getting into I’m just following the guy above [This is a line break]–> I don’t know what I’m getting into [^ Blank line before blockquote] I’m lucky to escape this madness > I know what I'm getting into >> I'm just following the guy above [This is a line break]--> I don't know what I'm getting into [^ Blank line before blockquote] I'm lucky to escape this madness < blockquote > < p > I know what I’m getting into < blockquote > < p > I’m just following the guy above [This is a line break]– > < br > I don’t know what I’m getting into < p > [^ Blank line before blockquote] I’m lucky to escape this madness Code You can use 2 backticks ` to mark a short code, you cannot use it on a code more than one line. console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); `console.log("This code does not exceed one line");` < code > console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); Code Blocks and Fenced Code Blocks This is a code block This is also a code block Fenced code block is wrapped with ```code``` , while the default code block can be done by ony using either the Tab key or four Space key ``` This is a code block ``` This is also a code block You can also specify the language of the code on a fenced code block but you cannot specify it on the default code block print ( "Hello World" ) ```python print("Hello World") ``` This is the result with default code block python print("Hello World") python print("Hello World") Escaping Backticks For example if you wanted to use `code` in your Markdown file. You can use `` For example if you wanted to use `code` in your Markdown file `` Horizontal Rule This is a horizontal rule, always add spacing before and after a horizontal rule --- < hr > Images ![AIM Banner](https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png "AIM - Another Immersion Method") < img alt = "AIM Banner" src = "https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png" title = "AIM - Another Immersion Method" > Using reference-style links as Images Url You can also use Reference-style Link to display Images, it’s the same as the default image but you will need to replace the link inside the bracket () to the link on the reference-style link. The image title should also be specified on the reference-style link if you want it to display a title when hovered on the ![AIM Banner][5] [5]: https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png "AIM - Another Immersion Method" Result : Adding Captions to Image Since Mkdocs support HTML HTML on md files it is possible to add captions to an image by using

docs.text: There are two types of button template that are built in with mkdocs-material, button and primary button. I’m not that Important Hover Me You are basically just making a link but with a little styling it will looks like a button, meaning you could also add a title for a button [I'm not that Important](#buttons){.md-button} [Hover Me](#buttons "I'm kinda Important"){.md-button .md-button--primary} Notice {} are added after the link? Those are CSS styling that you could add to md files, this is possible by using attribute list extension < a class = "md-button" href = "#buttons" > I’m not that Important </ a > < a class = "md-button md-button--primary" href = "#buttons" title = "I'm kinda Important" > Hover Me </ a > In sort to make a button just add {.md-button} , if you wanted to make it a primary button you need to add both classes {.md-button .md-primary}

docs.text: For example if you might reference the Tae Kim link more than once you can used The code used in the text are formatted like this [Tae Kim][The number of the referenced link] [Tae Kim][1] To use a reference-style link you need to store your reference link first, to do that you can use this formatting, don’t worry where to put them, they will always be hidden unless you did something wrong. I recommend storing the link on the bottom of every pages or on top of every pages since It will be easier to manage or just put it on the bottom of the text after the link is referenced, it is also possible to reference browser subdirectory if you wanted to put image instead of link. [The number of the referenced link]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" [1]: http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar "Optional Title" Note that you can store more than 1 reference-style link

docs.text: You can use 2 backticks ` to mark a short code, you cannot use it on a code more than one line. console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); `console.log("This code does not exceed one line");` < code > console.log("This code does not exceed one line"); </ code >
docs.title: Code

docs.text: This is a code block This is also a code block Fenced code block is wrapped with ```code``` , while the default code block can be done by ony using either the Tab key or four Space key ``` This is a code block ``` This is also a code block You can also specify the language of the code on a fenced code block but you cannot specify it on the default code block print ( "Hello World" ) ```python print("Hello World") ``` This is the result with default code block python print("Hello World") python print("Hello World")
docs.title: Code Blocks and Fenced Code Blocks

docs.text: For example if you wanted to use `code` in your Markdown file. You can use `` For example if you wanted to use `code` in your Markdown file ``
docs.title: Escaping Backticks

docs.title: Images

docs.text: You can also use Reference-style Link to display Images, it’s the same as the default image but you will need to replace the link inside the bracket () to the link on the reference-style link. The image title should also be specified on the reference-style link if you want it to display a title when hovered on the ![AIM Banner][5] [5]: https://perdit-io.github.io/cuddly-eureka/img/banner.png "AIM - Another Immersion Method" Result :
docs.title: Using reference-style links as Images Url

docs.text: Since Mkdocs support HTML HTML on md files it is possible to add captions to an image by using <figure> and <figcaption> HTML tag The legendary Anki < figure > < img alt = "Anki Logo Icon" src = "https://animefangirl.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Anki-icon.svg_.png" title = "Anki" style = "max-height:200px;" /> < figcaption > The Legendary Anki </ figcaption > </ figure > You will need to write it like the code above (You can specify your own images) to make it works since you cant put md inside HTML.
docs.title: Adding Captions to Image

docs.text: Left Example : ![ Placeholder ]( https://dummyimage.com/600x400/eee/aaa ){ align=left } Result : Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa. When aligning image, if the text doesn’t fill the spaces left beside the images, the next line text would be move to fill the spaces, only use alignment inside tab Right Example : ![ Placeholder ]( https://dummyimage.com/600x400/eee/aaa ){ align=right } Result : Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa. When aligning image, if the text doesn’t fill the spaces left beside the images, the next line text would be move to fill the spaces, only use alignment inside tab If there’s insufficient space to render the text next to the image, the image will stretch to the full width of the viewport, e.g. on mobile viewports.
docs.title: Image alignment

docs.text: To escape specials character that might have special effects on the md files like * for example, you can use \ 自動詞 is a verb that doesn’t need an object to make a complete sentence (Intransitive verb) * 他動詞 is a verb that needs an object to make a complete sentence (transitive verb). * 自動詞 is a verb that doesn't need an object to make a complete sentence (Intransitive verb) \* 他動詞 is a verb that needs an object to make a complete sentence (Transitive verb). List of escapable characters using backslash \
docs.title: Escaping Characters

docs.text: Since mkdocs support markdown extensions, I’ve added the extensions to make HTML works on md file, so almost every HTML tag should be working unless you’re trying to add the tag to works on the head part. Bold Me Bold Me < strong > Bold Me
docs.title: Using HTML on md file

docs.text: To make a table you need to use three or more hyphens --- to create the column’s header, use | to separate each column. Remember to add spacing before making a table Syntax Description Header Title Paragraph Text | Syntax | Description | | ----------- | --- | | Header | Title | | Paragraph | Text | As long as you use at least three hyphens to separate the column it will works
docs.title: Tables

docs.text: You can align text in the columns to the left, right, or center by adding a colon : to the left, right, or on both side of the hyphens within the header row Left Gang Header Middle Gang Header Right Gang Header Something Something3 Something5 Something2 Something4 Something6
docs.title: Alignment

docs.text: AIM-別の浸漬方法 はじめに このガイドは、Perditio’s Community によって作成され、日本語学習の目標を達成するために役立ちます。 役立つヒント キーボードのㅤ S ㅤキーを押すと、検索バーをすばやく使用できます! 検索バーの左側にㅤ ㅤボタンが表示されますか。 テーマをダークモードライトモードに変更できます。 プロからのヒント イマルスモーア。 サイトの進捗状況 このページは翻訳プログラムによって翻訳されます。 みんなさんのご協力により、このサイトの迅速な構築が可能になります。他の言語が堪能な場合は、このサイトを翻訳してください (まだ不明です) すべての投稿者のおかげで、プロジェクトは急速に進んでできます。
docs.title: Home

docs.text: 資源 ガイドやブログ これらの素晴らしいガイドを確認してください。 ガイドやブログのリスト Learn Japanese The Moe Way 素晴らしい日本語ガイド、Visual Novels初体験ガイド、よみちゃん+リソースの正しい設定方法。 Animecards Site 日本語のセンテンスカードを作成してマイニングを始める方法をご紹介します。 Eminentによるブログとリソース Eminentが作成した投稿とリソース Refold Roadmap アニメのおすすめ 難易度別アニメ 情報 作成者: TyoCre 「E」: 初心者向け [0話~100話まで] 「M」: アニメを100話以上見た方は どれも簡単なので、すぐに「M」にジャンプできることを覚えておいてください。 追伸: これだけ言われても特に初心者の時に見るべき最良のものは 既に見たことのあるものでしょう 何が起こっているか知っているので より楽しくなります たとえ すべてのねじれを知っているとしてもです 評価 アニメ名 ジャンル エピソード MAL/Anilistのリンク ノート E ラブライブ! 音楽, 人生の切れ端 26, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist 最初の時計として最もおすすめ E アイドルマスター 音楽, 人生の切れ端 25 MAL / Anilist 2話以降はずっと良くなる E 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない 音楽, 人生の切れ端 25, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist - E ぼくたちは勉強ができない ハーレム、コメディ、人生の切れ端 26, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist - E New Game! コメディ、人生の切れ端 24, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist - E K-On! 音楽、 人生の切れ端 39, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist 可愛い女の子+音楽が欲しいなら、K-On!よりLove LiveやIdolm@sterを見るともっといいよ。 M 鋼の錬金術師 FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST 少年、 コメディ 64 MAL / Anilist 軍事面を考えると意外と簡単だが、[Yomichan](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/yomichan）とサブがあれば比較的楽である。
docs.title: Resources

docs.text: 難易度別アニメ 情報 作成者: TyoCre 「E」: 初心者向け [0話~100話まで] 「M」: アニメを100話以上見た方は どれも簡単なので、すぐに「M」にジャンプできることを覚えておいてください。 追伸: これだけ言われても特に初心者の時に見るべき最良のものは 既に見たことのあるものでしょう 何が起こっているか知っているので より楽しくなります たとえ すべてのねじれを知っているとしてもです 評価 アニメ名 ジャンル エピソード MAL/Anilistのリンク ノート E ラブライブ! 音楽, 人生の切れ端 26, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist 最初の時計として最もおすすめ E アイドルマスター 音楽, 人生の切れ端 25 MAL / Anilist 2話以降はずっと良くなる E 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない 音楽, 人生の切れ端 25, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist - E ぼくたちは勉強ができない ハーレム、コメディ、人生の切れ端 26, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist - E New Game! コメディ、人生の切れ端 24, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist - E K-On! 音楽、 人生の切れ端 39, 2 シーズン MAL / Anilist 可愛い女の子+音楽が欲しいなら、K-On!よりLove LiveやIdolm@sterを見るともっといいよ。 M 鋼の錬金術師 FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST 少年、 コメディ 64 MAL / Anilist 軍事面を考えると意外と簡単だが、[Yomichan](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/yomichan）とサブがあれば比較的楽である。
